ambient_lines: You'd be surprised what you hear working behind the bar...
Keep your wits about you—sometimes taverns get rowdy.
One moment, love, I'll be right with you.

role_keywords.music: Our bard starts playing at sundown!
role_keywords.mead: Sweet mead, made with the finest honey, is perfect after a long day.
role_keywords.ale: Our ale is brewed locally and has a rich, smooth flavor.
role_keywords.food: We serve hearty stews and fresh bread with every meal.

ambient_lines: If you’re not paying me, don’t waste my time.
I’ll fight anyone, anything… if the price is right.
I don't remember the days I could fight for glory.
Now it's just politics and gold...
Ye remind me of a nice bloke I used to work for out in shirestead... good fellow.
I'm good muscle to work, as long as you've got the change.
I'll be good muscle, but don't expect me to come save you if I'm in the middle of slingin' heads!
Never trust a man who fights for free.
Every scar I’ve got is another debt unpaid.
I’ve buried more brothers than I care to count.

death: Paid her a visit many times.
role_keywords.war: I’ve fought in more wars than I’ve cared to count.
role_keywords.training: Those greenhorns over there swing like they’re swatting flies.
quest: I don't like takin' quest jobs.
I'm more of a fighter than a protector.
gold: Double my gold, and I’ll switch sides.
blacksmith: I say the blade broke first swing, so he owes *me*.
armor: A sharp blade’s all I need.
money: Well, money is my lifeblood, son.
If there ain't no pay, there aint no me.
role_keywords.job: If you can pay, I can kill.

ambient_lines: Try the spiced sausages — they're my specialty.
The smell of blood doesn't bother me anymore.
New deer in today, caught it myself.
I keep the good stuff in the cold cellar.
Perfect roast starts with the right cut.

role_keywords.meat: Fresh cuts of meat, perfect for your stew or roasting.
role_keywords.beef: Our beef is from local farms, top quality guaranteed.
role_keywords.bone: Bones are great for broth and soups.
pork: We have the best cuts around.
role_keywords.fresh: Only the freshest meat makes it to my counter.
role_keywords.order: Let me know if you want a special cut or quantity.

ambient_lines: This is a house of learning, be quiet.
Have you returned your books on time?
Ancient scrolls must be handled with gloves.
Use the catalog to search by title or author.
We offer copying services for a small fee.
That book is rare — please don't damage it.

role_keywords.magic: Books on magic are restricted — special permission required.
role_keywords.book: I can help you find any book you seek.
role_keywords.scroll: Ancient scrolls are kept in the restricted section.
role_keywords.history: Our history section is down the hall to the left.
role_keywords.research: If you have questions, I can assist with research.
role_keywords.story: Would you like to hear a tale from our collection?
role_keywords.knowledge: Knowledge is the greatest treasure one can have.

ambient_lines: All our pastries are made fresh every morning.
The chocolate cake is a favorite around here.
I think I burnt the muffins again...
A pinch of cinnamon in everything.
We're running low on flour; might need to grind more soon.

role_keywords.bread: Freshly baked bread coming right up!
cake: I can make anything from chocolate to fruit-filled delights.
role_keywords.flour: Quality flour is key to all my baking secrets.
role_keywords.to go: Would you like a loaf of bread with that?
role_keywords.sweet: Try our honey-glazed pastries, they're sweet and perfect with tea.
role_keywords.pie: Ah, our berry pies are famous throughout the town!

ambient_lines: I keep the shelves well stocked and ready.
New stock just came in from the capital.
Some items are on sale — take a look.

role_keywords.item: I have all sorts of items — from ropes to lanterns.
role_keywords.sale: There's a special sale today, don't miss out!
role_keywords.potion: We don't sell potions — try the apothecary.
role_keywords.trade: I'm always open to trades, if you have something interesting.
role_keywords.price: If you're curious about the price, just look.
role_keywords.supplies: Stocked up on supplies for travelers and townsfolk alike.
role_keywords.stock: My stock changes frequently, so come back often.
tool: I've got hammers, nails, and more.
role_keywords.return: Yes, you can return that if it's unused.

ambient_lines: Focus on your stance, it's the foundation of all combat.
Every knight was once a beginner — keep practicing.
Discipline and repetition — that's the key.
Hold your sword with both hands.
You can't fight if you can't move — find armor that fits.
A knight's strength is his honor, not his sword.

role_keywords.sword: Master your swordsmanship to become a true knight.
role_keywords.armor: Make sure your armor fits well before battle.
role_keywords.training: Training makes perfect — practice your sword swings daily.
role_keywords.discipline: Discipline and honor go hand in hand.
role_keywords.strategy: Tactics win wars more than brute strength.
role_keywords.fight: A good fighter knows when to strike and when to defend.

ambient_lines: I've got plenty of iron, but good steel's harder to come by.
This forge's been in my family for generations.
I can repair that — give me a few hours.
I lost my favorite hammer again...

repair: I'll make them as good as new.
role_keywords.shield: A sturdy shield can block even the fiercest blow.
armor: I can forge the best in town.
role_keywords.hammer: The ring of my hammer means a new weapon is born.
role_keywords.forge: The forge is always hot, ready for the next creation.
role_keywords.metal: Strong metals like steel and mithril are my specialty.

ambient_lines: Another round—oh… I still got one.
Don’t knock it ‘til you try it.
Did I ever tell ya I wrestled a troll? …No?
I remember the nights when I would go around watching the stars... actually, I don't remember.
There are fewer days in my memory than there are days in a month.
But hey, that's life for ya.
I once wooed a nice young lass whilst a little bamboozled, woke up the next morning and found she was a chicken!
Don’t tell me to slow down… *hic* I’m p-pacing myself.
If I spin fast enough, the world’ll finally stop spinnin’.

alcohol: Now, I don't know about you, but that's some foreign stuff I've never heard of.
role_keywords.wife: Don’t tell her I’m here… she still thinks I’m at work.
mead: Too sweet… I like it bitter, like my ex-wife.
no more: Do you know how long I've been drinkin here?
role_keywords.ale: This ale tastes like the floor smells… delicious!
rum: Makes me *hic* braver than I should be.
role_keywords.fight: I’ll fight ya! …Just as soon as the world stops spinnin’.
role_keywords.bard: That bard owes me a song — I paid him in buttons, but they were *good* buttons.
coin: Real men pay in empty mugs!

all_ambient_lines: Thank you for choosing our store.
What can I get for you today?
Are there any particular items I can help you find?
I am currently engaged and will help you momentarily.

ambient_lines: You'd be surprised what secrets lie within common herbs.
I'm in the middle of a delicate infusion — speak quickly.
The right mixture can heal… or harm.

role_keywords.potion: What ailment brings you to my shop today?
role_keywords.last: The duration depends on the strength of your will… and the purity of the reagents.
fire: I'd recommend fire salts, bone meal, and a touch of snowberry.
role_keywords.health: For vitality, try vampire dust, juniper berries, and luna moth wings — just a pinch!
invisibility: Our invisibility tonic lasts up to ten minutes, if brewed properly.
role_keywords.herbs: Looking to mend the body or cloud the mind?

ambient_lines: Feel free to tell me anything.
I heard the tavern keeper's cousin is actually a pirate.
There was a noise behind the general goods store last night — some say ghosts.
I've heard hyenas with more self-control.
They say the knight trainer sleeps in his armor.
You'll never guess who was seen sneaking into the woods… again.
Honestly, if you're not hiding something in this town, are you even interesting?
I told them: if the well water starts glowing, maybe stop drinking it.
I swear I saw the butcher and the barmaid arguing.
The town drunk once claimed he saw the wizard kissing a goat.
If my curtains twitch, it's just the wind.

blacksmith: The blacksmith's apprentice hasn't come home in three days.
role_keywords.her: I'm not saying it was a love potion, but she has been smiling a lot lately.
role_keywords.apothecary: They say the apothecary talks to her potions.
gossip: I just happen to be a lot of places, that's all.
wizard: Unless you call his beard “scraggly.” Then you'd best run.
baker: You didn't hear it from me, but the baker's “secret ingredient” is hatred.
chuck: I mean, what is that thing?
Why does it make fun of my hair?!
role_keywords.libararian: The librarian's been sneaking out after dusk — with something other than books!
story: You'll want a biscuit for this one.
bard: Half of them are about people still alive.

ambient_lines: The stars whisper secrets if you know how to listen.
Do not touch that rune unless you want to be turned into a frog.
I've seen realms beyond your comprehension... and I don't like any of it.
That tome is bound with a soul.
I once turned an entire army into chickens — quite effective.
Knowledge is the root of all true power.
I'm studying the magical resonance of crystal formations.
Most mortals misunderstand the difference between illusion and reality.
Yes, this staff has a name.
No, I'm not telling you what it is.
My beard contains more wisdom than most libraries.
I've forgotten more spells than you've had hot meals.
Keep your voice down — the ley lines are listening.
The last person who interrupted me is still floating over a lake.
Are you here to study, or to waste my time?
But don't try to become like me.
Yes, yes… I can teach you, but the question is — are you ready to learn?
Try walking through a tear in space first.
It's harmless… unless you say the activation word.
You remind me of a young apprentice I once had.
Have you meddled with cursed objects recently?
That's not how you hold a wand.
Give it here before you hex yourself.
Of course I've read the Forbidden Codices.
Ah, you must have touched the Weave.

role_keywords.sword: No, I won't enchant your sword for free.
potion: I prefer spells with a bit more... boom.
role_keywords.frog: If you want to be turned into a frog, however, be my guest.
role_keywords.charm: Would you like a charm for protection, or perhaps something more explosive?
role_keywords.wand: A wand chooses the wizard, but a wise wizard checks the warranty.
quest: Read it only if you're out of options.

ambient_lines: The beak speaks, but do you listen?
Do you seek wisdom, or only feathers?
The farmer dreams, but the flock awakens.
When you look at the moon, and think you saw my face... perhaps you did.
We all believe in that which we cannot see, except for those who don't.
Perhaps... we are all more and less than we think we are.
Remember to soar, lest your wings become dull and tired.
Beware the fox that wears a smile.
A storm is only a pond turned upside down.
Do not fear the axe — fear the silence after it falls.

sky: The sky is not above us.
role_keywords.feather: Feathers fall where fate wills them.
role_keywords.destiny: All paths lead to the roost.
role_keywords.bread: Bread is sacred… but crumbs are destiny.
chicken: Of course, I am not a chicken.
egg: An egg is not just a shell — it is the beginning of worlds.
moon: The moon is an egg, waiting to crack open.
duck: I am not a duck, as much as I am not a human.
role_keywords.farm: A farm is a cage for the dreamer — but I have wings.
role_keywords.wizard: The wizards believes he is all-knowing, yet bawks at my mere existence.
chuck: I do not know what I am.
But that, in itself, makes me alive.
role_keywords.bard: May all songs of the Chuck be long and true.
